body: @ni-ze Can you paste your test case,  I want to test if this problem exists in the version we are currently using.

4.9.1 

```xml
<dependency>
            <groupId>org.apache.rocketmq</groupId>
            <artifactId>rocketmq-client</artifactId>
            <version>4.9.1</version>
        </dependency>
```

Hello,

`this.instanceName = UtilAll.getPid() + "#" + System.nanoTime();`

It results in too many threads being created, requires a lot of memory.
When I upgraded rocketmq-client to 4.9.x,
my service  caused OOM error with Xmx512MB, 
but it worked fine below 4.9.0.

> If i want to update the core size greater than the old value, how to use it? defaultMQPushConsumer.setConsumeThreadMax(newValue + 1); defaultMQPushConsumer.updateCorePoolSize(newValue); ??

@yhhazr The consumeThreadMax is the value of `maximumPoolSize` of thread Pool. You can update the core size to a value less than consumeThreadMax. But the maximumPoolSize cannot be updated, the sdk does not provide a method to update this value.
